means: 动不动就发脾气地，急躁地

sentence.Network_en: She had grown ever more peevishly dependent on him.
sentence.Network_cn: 她脾气变得更坏，对他的依赖更重了。
布赖恩气恼地叹了口气。

sentence.Network_en: Paul looked through his green glasses peevishly when the other speaker brought down the house with applause.
sentence.Network_cn: 当另一个演说者赢得了满座喝彩声时,保罗心里又嫉妒又气恼.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 许国璋英语(第三册)单词表 - 豆丁网 ... oath n. 诅咒；怒骂 peevishly adv. 暴躁地 cash n. 现钱(即不是赊账).
" I've been sick , I told you , " he said , peevishly , almost resenting her excessive pity .“我生了一场病,我告诉过你了,"他没好气地说,对她的过分怜悯几乎产生了怨恨.

list.abs: say openly 公开地说say peevishly 气恼地说say peremptorily 专断地说
said Tony peevishly ., 托尼愤怒地说.

entry.def: Someone who is peevish is bad-tempered.

example.ex: Aubrey had slept little and that always made him peevish...
example.tran: 奥布里睡眠不足，这让他总是易怒。

example.ex: She glared down at me with a peevish expression on her face.
example.tran: 她低头瞪着我，一脸怒气。

auth_sentence.content: "Well, I was in seven," the Serbian said, peevishly.
auth_sentence.res_content: "Well, I was in seven," the Serbian said, peevishly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Well, I was in seven," the Serbian said, peevishly.

auth_sentence.content: "Whipping would be too good for Monsieur Henry," he said peevishly.
auth_sentence.res_content: "Whipping would be too good for Monsieur Henry," he said peevishly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Whipping would be too good for Monsieur Henry," he said peevishly.
